thread.title: Amir’s presence would enhance Pakistan against England
thread.title_full: Amir’s presence would enhance Pakistan against England

title: Amir’s presence would enhance Pakistan against England
text: Friday, 09 October 2015 14:43 Posted by Madiha Shakeel 0 Former England captain Alec Stewart has expressed that the Mohammad Asif and Salman Butt should be allowed to play international cricket after having completed their punishments. According to media reports Stewart said, “They have done their punishment. That’s what we expected which is that once you have completed your ban, you are entitled to come back into the game and play again”. Stewart added that more players will now be cautious before thinking about breaking rules. Pakistan and England are gearing up for an exciting Test series with the first match of the series starting from October 13. Reportedly, Stewart said Amir’s presence in the Pakistan side for the upcoming series against England would have made things interesting. He also believes that Pakistan will start as favourites in the upcoming series against his nation’s side in the United Arab Emirates (UAE). Copyright Business Recorder, 2015
